headline: Quinoa Side Dish
description: Try this easy quinoa side dish instead of rice! It's tossed with onion, garlic, and fresh herbs, and a splash of lemon juice for fresh flavor.

video.description: A quick, simple, sensational side dish that’s out of the ordinary.
video.name: Quinoa Side Dish

name: Quinoa Side Dish

recipeInstructions.text: Melt butter in a saucepan over medium heat. Add quinoa and toast, stirring occasionally, until lightly browned, about 5 minutes. Stir in broth and bring to a boil. Reduce the heat, cover, and simmer until tender, about 15 minutes.
Remove from the heat and transfer to a bowl. Stir in garlic, parsley, thyme, salt, and onion until combined. Sprinkle lemon juice over top.

review.reviewBody: Delicious! I’ve made it several times and it always turns out well. The last two times I made it added chopped fresh asparagus. Yummy!

Made as is! For the love of all things chocolate, do NOT sauté anything. The raw flavors is what makes this quinoa so tasty! I wasn’t sure how I would like it, but I was totally surprised. Just make this one as is, it’s pretty yummy with no modifications.

Excellent simple recipe. I changed a couple of things. I sautéd the onions in butter and olive oil for about five minutes before adding in and toasting the quinoa. I used fresh basil and cilantro and lime juice rather than lemon juice. Very tasty.
added zucchini and bell pepper and it was AMAZING! All my friends loved it

This was really good. I didn't use thyme, and did what a few others did - I sautéed the onions, garlic and mushrooms and put aside to add to the quinoa at the end. It was really delicious and a good intro for us to quinoa. Will def make again.
Delicious and easy.
Great! I added red bell pepper and used chicken broth. It is our new favorite quinoa dish!!
A few different spices . Good.
This recipe was delicious. Only thing is I didn't have fresh thyme, other than that it was fantastic! My daughter who's 8 even asked for 2nd's which is rare!
I really enjoyed this salad. I added cucumbers which I was happy about when I ate it.
Made this for my meat head husband to try something new and he loved it! It doesn’t specify but I used red onion which a greatly recommended. Also very good for breakfast with over easy eggs on top.
I put the onion and the garlic in after I added the broth and let them simmer together. Yummy!
super easy - also toasted with onion, garlic, and then threw it in the rice cooker with chicken broth and dried spices. Super easy and flavorful!!!
Great as is. My husband and I really enjoyed it!

I have been bored with the same old side dishes. This one is a great alternative. I loved it hot and cold. I was reluctant about the raw onion, but the heat takes away the onions bite & was the perfect amount of crunch.
New family favorite!
Best quinoa recipe I've ever tried. Has the nuttiness without being overwhelming. Great flavors!
Yummy, light and easy
A very nice change from rice or potatoes. A healthy, flavourful side dish.
Fantastic! Definitely adding this one to the rotation!

In preparation for a Sunday dinner, tried to take a short cut and steam quinoa in rice steamer, but after 30 minutes, much of the liquid still hadn't absorbed. Just placed in fridge, and returned a few hours later. To my surprise most of broth had absorbed. Placed in microwave for a ~3-5 minutes, but in the end had to strain. Used a couple more tablespoons of a light butter just to add a little more flavor and moisture. Used dried spices, in addition to adding salt and pepper. Came out great.
Amazing and I cannot even boil water without burning it
No changes and I’ll make it again; terrific!
We really liked this quinoa dish. I substituted ghee, turkey broth, and onion, and used dried herbs because that's what I had on hand. It was very tasty and ended up like a pilaf.

This is my go to dish its really nice. 
When I want to change it up a bit I will add corn or sometimes I saute some veggies and add it to the quinoa.
Fantastic!
Very good. I made with my homemade chicken stock which added a lot of flavor.
Great flavor ... love it!
Wow so fresh and delicious!
I really enjoyed this recipe, but next time that I make it I will decrease the onion slightly. It was the perfect side dish for summer veggies and chicken. Thank you so much for sharing!
Skipped the onion, but still tasty!

I made quinoa my first time with this recipe and I"m very pleased. I did saute the onions for 5 minutes, then the garlic for 1 minute before I added the quinoa. Also, I had to cook it about 20 minutes so maybe i cooked it on too low of temperature but it turned out very well. I served it with some leftover cut up chicken breast and steamed veggies which we very much enjoyed. I will definitely make this again.
I am not a huge fan of quinoa, but this was pretty tasty.

Very tasty. I added the onions and garlic in the saucepan while toasting the quinoa. I also used half low sodium chicken broth and half white wine instead of vegetable broth. It came out really good! As it is easy to make, I will definitely be adding this recipe to my go-to recipes.

I love this recipe! As a fairly new convert to quinoa, I was looking for a way to make it that would be super flavorful, and this was it! The first time I made it I added the thyme, but since then have left it out as the recipe doesn’t need it. This recipe is fantastic when made with either chicken or vegetable broth.

As someone who is both gluten intolerant and diabetic, rice is a no-no and finding side dishes that I can eat and my family will enjoy is no small feat. But this is the perfect side dish! My family raved. I did add diced red pepper but followed the recipe as it is otherwise. They've already asked me for this again! Thanks!
Used beef broth (had no chicken broth) and used onion pwdr vs chopped. It was quite a flavourful dish. An unexpected taste really. Yes, I would make it again.
I didn't like this dish because of the raw onions and garlic.

I don't really have go-to recipes; I'm always experimenting with what's on hand. But I'd like some healthy, simple recipes that are good enough to repeat over and over. This one makes that list! Excellent flavor and fun texture. Only subs I made were apple cider vinegar instead of lemon juice, and I subbed in some Creeping Charlie weeds to augment my sparse parsley. Thanks for a keeper!
I used 1 cup fresh coarse chopped spinach in place of the fresh parsley. I also used mushroom bouillon in place of the vegetable broth. Used what I had and it was great.
Pretty good for an easy weeknight side dish. Did as others suggested & put the onions & garlic in beginning

This recipe is simple and good. Changes I made: I did not have fresh thyme or parsley so I used dry (making the necessary changes in amounts for dry). I also followed other reviewer and sautéed the onions in the butter. I can't wait to make this again. I plan on adding some veggies to it next time. Thanks for sharing the recipe :-)

Really enjoyed this recipe! Great side with almost anything. My kids enjoyed this and they aren't huge fans of quinoa.
Will make it again!!

This recipe was delicious! I did sautee the garlic and onion before adding it to the quinoa and used dried thyme, a little garlic powder and some parmesean cheese. Just personal preference on the changes.
Very easy and mild flavor, but I would probably add more salt or garlic for a little more flavor.

This is perfect for a side dish or Lunch entreé. I've paired it with chicken, salmon, pork, and steak. I've also just taken it as is for lunch! One suggestion, my husband and I found the taste to be rather bland using the vegetable broth so we have used chicken broth to give it a little flavor boost.

I saw one reviewer made it in their rice cooker, so I did that as well, after I had sautéed the onion, garlic, and quinoa. When the quinoa was done, I added some chopped spinach. I also made the "Arkansas Green Beans" recipe from allrecipes.com and after tasting them I mixed the two together to make one marvelous tasting dish.

My whole family loves this recipe, even my little kids who can be quite picky when they feel like it. I didn't have everything on hand so the only thing I substituted was chicken broth for vegetable broth. I loved using the fresh parsley and thyme! I am so glad to have found a delicious healthy quinoa recipe!
Nice light side dish; I served it with garlic chicken.

Great easy recipe. Only changes I made were cooking onion and garlic from the beginning in the butter to soften them. and I tossed in the thyme as it was cooking instead of after. I also added some steamed broccoli which I broke up with a wooden spoon so that it was in very small pieces, almost blended in with the texture of the quinoa.

This was easy to make. This was the first time we have tried quinoa. It's like a better version of cous cous. We'll be making this again, it's a nice change of pace from our potato and rice based side dishes.
I decided to sauté the onions and garlic which turned out delicious. I will definitely make this dish many more times.

I have made quinoa multiple ways, but my husband has never actually liked it... until THIS! I make it just as the recipe calls, except sometimes substituting dried minced onions out of laziness : ) If you are looking to cut down the fat for THM lifestyle, simply sauté it in a small amount of coconut oil spray!

I used olive oil instead of butter, cut out the salt completely, used a low sodium vegetable broth, and dried herbs. It was pretty tasty. Maybe a tiny bit dry but I didn't use much olive oil and it sat for a second or two on the stove top so I will blame my culinary skills on that. I really appreciated the flavor of the onions and garlic with the quinoa.

This was my first time making and eating quinoa. I am a picky eater and was kind of scared to try it, but I found it to be pretty good and I look forward to experimenting more with this food.

This was my first attempt at making quinoa not out from a box mix and we loved it! I sauteed the onion & garlic at the beginning before adding the quinoa to it because I wouldn't have liked it crunchy. I used chicken broth since it's all I had and was serving it as a side dish with chicken. I stirred in only salt & parsley at the end. Will definitely be making again!
Followed the recipe and it didn't turn out. Won't make again.
Stir in chopped tomatoes to add additional texture and color.

I've been looking for new ways to make quinoa and came across this. I rinsed my quinoa because the package told me to do so. It's definitely more flavorful using the Vegetable Stock instead of cooking quinoa with regular water (I used Rachael Ray's Vegetable Stock). I used the optional squeeze of lemon. I liked the combination of flavors.

Great recipe. For those who asked, quinoa needs to be rinsed of the bitter saponin coating unless otherwise directed on package labeling. I measure what I want to use, soak it in a large cup of water for 20 minutes, dump it in a mesh sieve and rinse before proceeding by mixing it with some oil in a skillet and stirring periodically over medium heat to brown it lightly and bring out the nutty flavor. Once browned a bit, I add enough hot water to exceed the top by about a 1/4 inch, cover it, lower the heat, set a timer for 15 minutes, turn the heat off at that point and let it sit with the cover on for another 10 minutes. If I want it drier, I just remove the lid, turn on the heat and stir it until more water evaporates. At this point I can refrigerate it so it's ready to go for any recipe. It freezes well at this point, too - just be sure it's fridge-cold before freezing since the steam from warm food is what causes the proliferation of annoying ice crystals. I keep a container of plain cooked quinoa in the freezer at all times so I can scrape some into oatmeal or scoop out some for a salad topper, etc. It separates easily with minimal microwave power. Amazing, nutritious, versatile stuff.

Made this as a side for Pork Ribs Piquant and it went over great. I used rice as I didn't have Quinoa and chicken broth instead of the vegetable broth. I also sauteed the onion and spices in butter then poured them into the rice.
Will definitely be looking for Quinoa when I shop so I can make it more authentic.
A new favorite in our house. I add vegetables sometimes or top with chicken or beef to make it a meal.

I spoke words tonight that I never thought I would hear myself say: "This quinoa is really good." Like someone else said they did, I cooked the garlic in the same pan when I toasted the quinoa. I caramelized the onions separately, but in retrospect I guess I didn't have to do that-I just could've cooked the onion and garlic in the same pan. Oh, and I didn't have any vegetable broth so I used chicken broth. The quinoa was definitely *not* quicker than rice-took more like 20 minutes. But if you want something a little healthier than rice or potatoes, or just want something different, give this a try. At first I didn't like the firmer texture of quinoa, but now I love it.

This was a great, light, summery dish! It went very well with lemon salmon! It would be good hot or cold. The only change I made was to do chicken broth instead of vegetable broth, which I did due to what I had on hand, but also I think it tastes better. I finally have a quinoa recipe I enjoy!
really liked this!

SO GLAD I FOUND THIS RECIPE!!!

So many times I've attempted to cook quinoa and have failed miserably. This recipe made me feel like victory is mine! A couple of changes I have made to make this recipe better. I toasted the quinoa with a tablespoon of butter and a teaspoon of olive oil. I after 2 minutes of toasting the quinoa I added the diced onion. After dumping in the vegetable stock, I seasoned it heavily with sea salt and lemon pepper. I ended up having to cook the quinoa closer to 18 minutes as opposed to the recommended 15 minutes to have all the liquid absorbed. I didn't have thyme so I omitted that. Will definitely make again!!!

Great recipe - I followed a couple reviewers changes, using garlic olive oil instead of butter, chicken broth instead of veg, and dried seasonings, onion powder, pepper, etc. Mine also needed much more time than suggested to fluff up, but I expected that. Great way to add variety to a sometimes boring side dish! I served it with salmon and asparagus, and it went very well together.
Super yummy!

I LOVED this recipe (after a simple change). The reason I gave it 4 stars is because I had to slightly change it. I sauted the onions and garlic in the butter before adding the quinoa and then added the quinoa and continued to saute everything together. I tried it the other way (as the recipe instructs) and the taste was quite different. If you're new to quinoa this is a great way to introduce yourself to a great power food.
Very flavorful! I used vegetarian chicken broth (found at Whole Foods). I topped it with whole cashews for dinner with a side of broccoli. Yum! Will make it again!

I made this as a side for a turkey. My turkey got done cooking early, so I took some of the turkey broth and substituted for the veggie broth. This turned out very tasty. I'm thinking of using it for this years holidays, as a substitute for stuffing. (I also used dried herbs because that is what I had available)
Made it in a rice cooker and it turned out fantastic

This was a great alternative to rice. As others suggested, I first cooked the onions and garlic in the butter a little before adding in the quinoa to toast. I used chicken broth instead of vegetable broth. Like rice, I cooked it until the liquid had been absorbed. It was really good. I had guests for dinner, and it was their first experience with quinoa. They loved it, as did my husband. Thank you, sal.

I have had quinoa before but never was overly impressed with it, but I think only had it undercooked so when I tried this recipe it makes sure it is fully cooked & it was wonderful. I'm actually going to be more careful in the future cooking other recipes with quinoa due to how great the quinoa was in this recipe.

This is really tasty. I made it with chicken stock instead of the vegetable broth since that is what I had on-hand. Also cooked the onions with the quinoa as suggested by another reviewer. The only criticism I had was that it felt a touch under-spiced, like it needed a few more herbs, more garlic, or a touch of curry powder or something to add a bit more flavor. Still, really good dish that I'm going to make again and see about tweaking.

I absolutely love this recipe. I also sauteed the onion and garlic. I put in basil as I had no parsley on hand, it was very good. I make enough to have leftovers as I like it cold as a salad. I stuff avocado with and it makes a very healthy and tasty lunch.

Was never a big fan of quinoa.. but this however was FANTASTIC! I actually prefer this side dish to rice, which is a crazy thing for me to say. It's got so much great flavor! Definitely making this over and over again!
The onions are much too powerful in this dish. My advice is do not make with raw onions, cook them first. Braggs Amino's saved it.
This is simply wonderful. Excellent as a warm side, or even the day after as a cold salad! Easy to make, great ingredients, delicious and versatile.

First time cooking quinoa, I used butter and put the onions and garlic in to cook with the quinoa. I used chicken broth to boil in and added some fresh thyme, cumin and cayenne pepper. Towards the end I added corn and peas. Very good alternative to rice.
I made this recipe to and absolutely loved it! I was in a bit of a rush, so after I cooked the quinoa, I just added lemon juice and some fresh garlic. Love, love the texture and nutty flavor.
Used only a. Little thyme , added carrots
simple, fresh, delicious & perfect as a side dish! have made this a few times and my husband really likes it
Flavors are good and it's an easy recipe to make but, I a, definitely going to sautée the onions and garlic and then cook with the Quinoa.
Waaaaaaayyyyy too much onion. Nice enough but if I try this again I will use 2 tbsp max not an entire small onion.
Very good I will make this again!
Loved this. Made with low sodium chicken broth and sautéed the onions and garlic prior to adding the quinoa to toast. Cooked for 25 mins. Delicious.

Delicious! I only had dried herbs, and I did what someone else mentioned and I sauteed the onions and garlic before toasting. The onions and garlic then cooked in the broth with the quinoa. It was great!
Pretty good and easy. Light and healthy.

Very good. I saute'd the onions and garlic first as suggested by another rater. I used chicken broth because I didn't have veggie broth. We had it with Basil Pesto Chicken from an online blog - It was a really good dinner.

I did not care for this recipe. My husband ate his but didn't want it for lunch the next day (that never happens). I don't usually toast it before I cook it; not sure if I want to try that again. :-( 

It seemed lacking in flavour, except that it was a bit bitter, even though I thoroughly rinsed the quinoa before cooking it. I am not sure I want to use the red variety again, at this point...
I'm not a big fan of quinoa but this was fantastic! I made it just as the recipe said and will keep it the same next time too.
Oh my gosh this is amazing! I followed everything to a T and added 1/2 veggie Bouillon cube to it and it's just mouth watering!
Tasty sidedish and was great with fresh salmon. I didn't have fresh parsley and thyme on hand, but next time when I do it will be even better

This was really tasty. I made a few modifications. To make mine a little healthier, I used butter spray instead of butter. For the broth I used reduced sodium chicken broth, it really adds to the flavor; I omitted the 1/4 tsp salt because it really isn't needed with all the other spices. I will definitely make this again.
Did same as other readers, sautéed garlic and onions before adding quinoa. Turned out well but, even though my husband went for seconds, just don't think quinoa greatly appeals to us.

Love this! I did add the onions and garlic while browning the quinoa because I don't like raw onions. I also added some fresh basil instead of the thyme only because it was all i had on hand. Great recipe!

I used dried rosemary in this I had no parsley. Used a teaspoon in grinder with red pepper garlic salt and black pepper. Shook with lemon juice rice vinegar a spot of grape seed oil and finely sliced onion. Took a serving portion of the quinoa dressed lightly with the potion. So fine!

I've made this recipe many times. I always cook the onion and garlic with the quinoa. I also add about half a cup of sliced carrots and a bell pepper and instead of veggie broth, I use chicken. When the quinoa is close to done I add some frozen peas. i think the vegetables make this dish so much tastier and more satisfying! I eat it more as a meal than a side but it is great with salmon! I think I may try adding some broccoli too next time.
This was ok, maybe needed more ingredients to add some flavor. Will make it again.
